title: Where Does Agency Reside? The Insufficiency of Models.
description:
Owen Barfield by DiFuccia
Saving the Appearances by Owen Barfie
Maps of Meaning by Jordan B. Peterson

Active (poein) and passive (paschein)
Passive/suffer/permit
Initiate/respond

Meaning is where the immanent meets the transcendent. Our practical connections ton the truth is of primary importance. Take note of whether you are "coming together" or have a sense of dissipation (disintegration) - moving further from the core of who you are. Meaning on a grand scale is a culmination of all the smaller stories to create a transcendent meaning.

The modern tries to displace God by being God ourselves.
Surrender requires believing that we would be surrendering to someone good. Postmoderns seem to believe that reality is a bad gift.

We have a static picture of what will make us happy. Models provide a simplification of reality.

We want the skills, the process. Built into wonder is gratitude, the soreness of reality. Mysticism keeps men sane (Chesterton). We want to control and predict, but reciprocal narrowing hijacks a legitimate process. We end up with an inability to reintegrate the information from that smaller frame into the larger frame.
